這是一款懷舊類型的點擊養魚遊戲，每餵一次飼料就要扣5塊錢，把小魚養大後會開始有魚的便便錢。

遊戲以關卡制在進行，所以每一關都是新的開始，每當右上方的蛋買到可以孵化時，就是新關卡的時候。
這時候會有新的生物進駐水族箱中，像是幫忙撿錢的蝸牛啦，或是會生珍珠的青蛙蚌啦…

玩一玩還會有異形來抓你買的魚，這時就是增加滑鼠點擊次數的時候了。
這款唯一的缺點應該是不能切換視窗掛著看，而且也不大適合放置它吧，是一款很忙的點擊類型養魚遊戲。

38762807.review:
SO HAPPY THIS IS ON STEAM !!

Used to play this game a lot when I was younger [I would play it the second I came from school almost every day !!], found the old disk for it but it was so scratched I couldn't play it. After reliving old memories by watching gameplay videos of it I found out it was on Steam ! I may have some biases due to loving this game so much in my earlier years, but here is my review;

SUMMARY: [Scroll down for Pros/Cons]
Basically you click to feed your fish in each level, you can also click to collect the coins they drop,pet after the first few levels who will pick up the coins for you, there are other pets later on who do the same thing. 
The main game is like a clicker game but it's different. You start off with two guppy fish in each level, you start with being able to feed them one food at a time, then as they grow [they have 3 growth stages] they will unlock new items and fish to help you progress in the level so you can unlock an egg which gives you a new pet. 
The pets help you do certain tasks, some of them will drop coins, or keep your guppies safe, or help you battle off the aliens that come in each level.
Speaking of the aliens, those appear every level, and there are many different kinds of them that have their own abilities, and their own way for you to kill them.
The game has a total of 5 tanks, and 21 levels, the last one being a final boss. There are a total of 24 pets, you get one after the end of each level, and the extra ones you buy with Shells, a currency that you get in special bonus levels that allows you to buy pets and fish in the Virtual Tank
The Virtual Tank was made for the "animated wallpaper" craze of the early 2000s, you can set it to be a screensaver. You can also buy fish from a shop that changes daily, the fish you buy from here grow if you check on them daily and they also drop Shells.

"Well what can I do after I beat the main game ?"
There is a challenge mode unlocked after beating the main game where being similar to the main game where you avoid alien attacks and try to get the egg, every 4 seconds an item increases 1% of its original price, but once an egg piece is bought the prices reset, the longer you play this mode the harder the aliens that attck you get, you get awarded shells for completing challenge mode levels.
There is also a time-trials mode where instead of egg peices you buy an egg that contains a random pet that  will assist you until all pets are in use, the goal of this mode is to make as much money before time runs out, 5% of the money you earn will be converted to shells.

TL;DR SUMMARY:
The best way I can explain it in short is it's a bit like cookie clicker with more depth.
There's also aliens. 

PROS:
- Fun and simple gameplay that is easy to understand and a good time-waster
- Amazing graphics that hold up for being released in 2002 !!
- Many gamemodes and game types
- Great soundtrack ! [Love the Tank 2 theme, it's so calming]
- A great game to play to take your mind off things for a bit
- Many levels, unlockable fish and pets, and more
- Fun little Easter-Eggs that may spice things up

CONS:
- May be too repetitve for some people
- Tank 1 soundtrack is kinda headache-inducing if you play through the tank in one go
- Can become boring if you try to beat it all in one go, try to break it up over a few days or weeks

That's all I have for cons ! Again, I may have bias,,, 
Totally reccomend this game though !

38728051.review:
This was my childhood game, and although I have this as not recommended, I do recommend this game if you have also experienced this game in your early days, and want to re-experience that. As for newcomers, unless you're 10 years old or younger, I don't recommend this game at all. 

So why don't I recommend this game? Simple, it's incredibly repetitive. When in your first levels, you may enjoy the game, but then after I would say the fourth or fifth level, is when you will probably just get bored of the game and probably just stop playing the game ever again due to its heavy repeating. Not only that, but the game practically requires an auto clicker to stop from cramping your finger/hand after awhile on all levels. But other then all of that, if you do plan to get this game, I would say your best bet is to treat this like solitaire, or minefield, in terms of if you get really bored, and you don't really have any other game to play, it can probably help you out in that regard.

38627969.review:
简单的指引一下
1.不要舍不得多买高级鱼，他们带来的利润很可观
2.利用鱼食可以把鱼群相对的吸引到安全的角落（也可能不安全）
3.如果你已经解锁了灯笼鱼或者海豚请无视2条
4.你的鱼群成型后记住只点高级鱼掉下来的的钱就好，第四大关尤其重要，这是为你的手和鼠标着想
5.第四大关不必执着的把所有鱼喂饱，这不现实，死点就死点，保护你的手和鼠标
6.对付终极boss的武器不是连发的，请你做好心理准备，这是一场恶战，很累
7.具体的购买和升级顺序，个人推荐是二级鱼食→三级鱼食→鱼食上限（根据关卡和鱼的数量决定买到几级）→高级鱼1-2条→武器到满级→高级鱼（完善食物链）蛋壳
8.一二大关买武器没啥用，第二大关的稻草人只能喂食，不费钱的。第三四大关武器满的越快越好，章鱼这种东西即使变蓝了也要把他压在墙角里，只要他想往外走你就在外侧开火挡住他，第二波连射一定能打死他。独眼巨人在你鱼群密集的时候就别打他的子弹了，除非你有天使鱼给你兜着，但是你有了天使鱼就更没必要打那个子弹了，同时出现的机器人基本不用管他的导弹。但是第二大关还是要把机器人的导弹打掉
简单地推荐一下好用的宠物
1.大蚌Niko
1-2大关以及第三大关前期都是神器，定期的提供250元，可以让你在前期就可以直接多买几条古比鱼，对后面经济成型有较大帮助。三大关后期还是换掉吧，不够看的。第四大关买的是古比鱼妈妈，会让你前期喂食喂到死，数目更是不够看
2.鱼妈Prego
提供源源不断的小古比鱼！万金油！
3.海马Zorf
他可以直接吐出二级鱼食，在前面三大关都可以用，第四大关有更重要的宠物选，就换掉了，而且一次只能吐一个，效率稍慢
4.人鱼Meryl
每次唱歌会让你的古比鱼吐出三倍钱币！但是间隔略长，而且三四大关你的主要经济来源不再是钱币，适用性就不好了，但是比Niko还是好点，第四大关前中期也可以带，用来前期多买几条鱼妈使你的鱼群成型，放在你的宠物鱼缸里是很好的，每次唱歌可以让你的santa掉60贝壳！（你买的第一条古比鱼起名santa就会变成santa，每次都掉+20贝壳袋）
5.海豚Blip
可以提前解锁你要买的所有东西，并且显示哪些鱼饥饿（三角标记）并且在外星人进犯时候会显示出现的位置和血量，到了4-4和4-5不太适用（或者说很有用），因为外星人一般出来就是俩，而且很大几率就是出现在你鱼群中
6.电鳗AMP
单独出现很鸡肋，把你的所有古比鱼电死（留下一条）全变成钻石，但是和天使鱼Angie搭配很好！第四大关中期过渡出巨型食肉鱼时候这个搭配很好用
7.天使鱼Angie
复活你死去的鱼（被近战型外星人直接粉碎的不管用），可以和AMP搭配，第四大关后期鱼很可能喂不过来，有了她就能帮你搞定（掉到鱼缸底部的尸体仍会消失）
8.蝌蚪Presto
终极神级宠物，是用一只断手和一个坏掉的鼠标换回来的
可以变成你拥有的任意宠物，因此有了它可以使打法更为灵活，在挑战模式中之前提到的不得不替换的宠物也可以出场了
但是他本体并没什么功能
9.拳套乌鸦（通关后贝壳购买的第四个宠物）
几次出拳后会休眠，出拳击中的鱼会掉他自己的财宝（好像是，其实略鸡肋）

Absolute classic, holds up shockingly well over a decade later. The strategies remain juuust deep enough to be engaging while still utterly casual at its core, other than some rather sudden late-game click-fest enemies/bosses.

My only complaint would be the various pet selections, which vary in usefulness from pretty much essential (for maybe about 3-5 of them) to absolutely useless (literally all the rest). The exceptions being the late game unlocks, which easily trump all the standard ones, at the cost of the four "bonus" ones being a heck of a grind.

It feels wrong to complain about though - ultimately, the game oozes charm, the sprites and animations shine, and it remains eminently and enjoyably playable to this day.

🐟/10

36430677.review:
[h1]스팀에 등장한 추억의 명작 플래시게임[/h1]

광란의 수족관 디럭스는 외계인들을 무찌르고 물고기들을 별 탈 없이 키우는 게임입니다.
옛날에 이 게임을 해본 적이 있었는데, 그때의 추억이 무럭무럭 솟아나서 스팀에 장만하게 됬네요.
딱 옛날에 제가 해봤던 그 게임 그대로입니다.

[b]게임의 시스템[/b]
기본적으로 마우스 클릭으로 먹이를 줘서 물고기를 성장시킨 뒤, 성장한 물고기가 주는 돈을 받아 더 많은 물고기를 사고 최종적으로는 펫 알을 사는 것이 목적인 게임입니다. 그 과정에서 외계인이 나타나 물고기를 먹기도 합니다.

일단 이 게임은 노가다 게임입니다. 플레이어가 하는 일은 1. 물고기에게 먹이주기, 2. 상점에서 아이템 사기, 3. 외계인 무찌르기정도 밖에 없습니다.2번은 많이 할 일이 없지만, 1, 3번은 단순한 클릭을 많이 해야합니다. 이렇게까지 말하면 단순한 노가다게임이지만, 이 게임의 묘미는 바로 성장하는 물고기를 보는 것, 그리고 먹이사슬을 잘 컨트롤하는 것에 있습니다.

먹이사슬관계는 용사주제에 건방지다마냥 복잡하지 않고 간단합니다. 그렇기에 복잡한거 싫어하는 유저도 쉽게 접할 수 있습니다. 먹이사슬관계에 놓인 생물이 최대 3개밖에 안됩니다. 이 먹이사슬을 컨트롤하는 것은, 이 게임이 단순한 노가다 게임이 아니다라는 것을 명확히 보여주는 시스템인데, 수족관의 생태계를 잘 조절하는 묘미가 있습니다.

장점
+다양하고 독특한 동료들
+단순하면서 재미있는 게임구조
+ 클리어후 할 수 있는 요소들.(버추얼 탱크, 설정 etc)
단점
- 반복적임. 
- 특별한 이벤트가 없음
- 긴장감없는 외계인
- 매우 쉬운 난이도

평점은 6/10

The love put into this game, like all Popcap games shows. They literally studied gold fish to make this game. The aliens are really creative with a lot more variety than you'd expect, a lot of cool mechanics, purposefully made tedious (in a good way of course). This game will give you a good 10 hours if your quick and as with every Popcap game (or most with a campaign) it is possible to replay the campaign, but obviously it isn't as easy as the previous expedition, and the game comes with a virtual fish tank with a shop refreshing daily with new creatures to add your tank. Oh and it comes with a nifty screen saver of your virtual tank. Overall this game is a huge 9/10 from me, only cons were that I wish there were more levels to the main game, and maybe a couple more bosses, but now I'm looking for things to critisize. Basically to sum it up, a lot of hand hurting, a lot of fish death but boats full of fun

34867954.review:
Insaniquarium! Deluxe is a game I have played in my childhood- as many other reviewers here have. However, even if you are older than 6, I think you may still like this game, I'll explain.
Insaniquarium is an old game, there are 2 things you are required to do: You are tasked with simply buying/feeding fish, occasionally doing certain things to keep bigger or different fish alive (like feeding a bigger fish normal fish, or feeding even bigger fish the already mentioned big fish that feeds on your normal fish, or feeding a certain creature beetles).
The other thing you must do is defend your fish from aliens by shooting them with your laser gun. 
You can save up money to bye temporary upgrades that can make your job easier, such as getting the ability to give the fish more than 1 thing of food at a time, getting better food, or getting a better gun (the final upgrade turns your gun into an automatic weapon, making tougher levels super easy). 
The main goal of Insaniquarium is to save up enough money to bye all 3 peices of an egg, once this is done, you unlock a companion fish that can help you out in your playthrough. You also move on to the next stage- there are 4 stages and you after you get the last egg, you move on to the fifth and final stage (which is only 1 level).

There are a few modes besides the main story, such as a time trail mode, a normal fish tank mode where you buy and take care of fish without the danger of aliens, and a mode after the main story that allows you to reply the game with all of your companions (and you even get a story of the companions after each level).

Now as to why I recommend this game... it is a fun little game that will keep you occupied if you don't have much money, or you are just looking for something small to play. 
Perhaps you are a parent and you're trying to buy a game for your kid- in that case then get this game for them! Trust me, this will be something they cheris throughout their livesand if you get involved and play the game with them, it will be a memorable expirience.

My score for the game is a 6/10 as a normal game, and an 8/10 for nostalgia value.

Summary: Insaniquariam is a childhood favourite game amongst most people. The game is as simple as it says. "Feed fish and fight aliens!" Imagine cookie clicker but actually interesting. You start out with two Guppies in your tank and as you progressively feed them they grow larger leading to bigger rewards. After each level you beat you unlock a new pet which is a creature with a special ability to spice up and change gameplay. 

Insaniquariam has 4 modes, Adventure mode: The main gameplay, Time Trial: It speaks for itself. Challenge mode: You must beat adventure mode to unlock this but again, self explanatory. 


Pros: 
-Fun gameplay that can put sometimes be put understress
-excellently executed idea.
-Great time passer.
-Cute art style
-CUSTOM SCREEN SAVER
-Nostalgia, for some.

33096479.review:
プレイヤーはアクアリウムの管理人となり、グッピーをはじめとしたお魚たちの世話をします。
グッピーたちがお腹を空かさないようこまめにエサを与えつつ、彼らがドロップするコインを集め『卵』を3回購入すればステージクリアー。
水槽内のお魚がみんな死んでしまうとゲームオーバーです。

このゲーム一番の特徴はなんといってもエイリアンが登場するところ！
某映画に出てきたようなものから、あなたエイリアンじゃないでしょとツッコミたくなるものまで様々な種類が登場します。
エイリアンはお魚たちを食べてしまうので放っておくとあっという間にゲームオーバーです。現れたら攻撃してやっつけましょう。
なんで水槽の中にエイリアンが…？というツッコミは厳禁ですよ！（笑）

自分だけのアクアリウムを作れるバーチャルタンク機能も魅力的。
本編でお目にかかれないあんなグッピーやこんなお魚がたくさん登場します。稀にとんでもないモノが登場することも…？
お魚の購入には『シェル』と呼ばれるアイテムが必要になりますが、購入した個体は死なないので安心して飼うことができます。
このバーチャルタンク、なんとスクリーンセーバーにもできるのでゲームをしていないときでもお魚たちの泳ぐ姿を見て楽しむことができますよ！

ステージ進行に合わせて卵の価格が上昇、エイリアンも手ごわくなっていくため難易度はそこそこ高くやり応えも十分です。
残念ながら日本語は未対応ですが、遊ぶ上で支障になることはまずありません。

気になった点はチャレンジモードTANK3・4の難易度でしょうか。
ネタバレになるので詳しくは書きませんが『再生能力持ちの極めて強力なエイリアンが4匹同時に、しかもバラバラな位置に出現』します。
他のエイリアンだったらまだ対処のしようがあるのですが、このエイリアンだけは4匹現れるとほぼ確実に"詰み"です。
やりこんだ人向けのモードなので難しいのは重々承知していますが、ここだけは理不尽さを感じました。

エイリアンをやっつけながら、ひたすらグッピーを育てる…見かけは単純なゲームですが中毒性が高く、一度ハマるとなかなかやめられません。
昔はネット上で時間制限付きの体験版（？）が公開されていたので、意外とご存知な方も多いと思います。
特徴的なグッピーの姿を見て懐かしいなと思ったそこのアナタ！ぜひ購入して遊んでみてくださいね！

32749459.review:
[WARNING: Couple of spoilers here and there]

Back in about 2004 when I was around 3-4 years old I first found this game on Popcap as the free online version. It had no music, and only one area but I remember playing it for hours. It was simple, but it was the perfect blend of tricky mechanics and pacing that kept me coming back.

Fast-forward to about 2012 to when I was around 12 my father had purchased a Popcap collection that included this along with some other favorites of mine like Heavy Weapon. I remember being glued to it for hours. I'd never had so much fun with it as I had with any other game. At the time I had played stuff like XIII, the Sly Coopers, Ace Combat 5, Call of Duty Finest Hour, Medal of Honor Frontline, and some of the classics such as Deus Ex and Half-Life. Yet the music and the simple structure of Insaniquarium gave me a sense of euphoria that I hadn't felt before at the time. Much of it was childhood nostalgia but I remembered at the time admiring the atomspehere and rising difficulty. For being about 11-12 the amount of fish and money required to finish each level was enough of a challenge to encourage me to keep going. I remembered finding the levels in the 4 area to be outright hell. The concepts were simple to follow, the bosses were varied to create some doubt when entering a new level. The music was very cheerful and inviting, setting a friendly environment for the most part and but even the later levels also created a sense of the rising challenge. There's only about 5 tracks but each sets the mood all on its own without too much duplication, with the exception of the main menu music being reused for level 4. At the time, it was a firm favorite that seemed to encompass everything I found to be fun with elements of management, survival, and even a minor shooting portion thrown in. All within a game about feeding fish. It seemed flawless.

Fast-forward to about 2016 when I opened this account. Having been unable to own a computer powerful enough for Steam for years I was supremely curious to see what was available here. When I discovered that the old gems of Popcap were available I snapped it up instantly (Inspite of it being about $80 at the time). I immediately downloaded the favorites: Heavy Weapon, Chuzzle, Hammer Heads, and of course, Insaniquarium. And so the question presented itself, did the game still hold up 5 years later at the age of 17? Well right off the bat I could say that the difficulty certainly was not what I remembered. When was a kid the game took me quite some time to beat as I said I found the level 4 area to be hell quite often. Well after being dedicated to beating it I swept through the game across a few days with a collective time of about 6 hours. The management boiled down to just setting up a system that got you the money you needed without committing fish genocide and staying within your complusory money-burning budget to get each egg shard to complete the level. The bosses themselves were only a minor disturbance especially because I did not remember what type was what. All except for the Squid monster, screw that one. Being invulnerable and then laying waste to countless fish peoples upon normalizing caused more headaches and vexations than I remembered. The convoluted set-up of guppys to guppymunchers to beatle muncher in the level 3 area was both an inviting challenge and a Gordian Knot constructed only with the purpose of slowing down your monopolization of the fish and egg-shard market. Otherwise the levels were still fun. Although shorter on account of me panicking less when fish started turning into skeletons due to Squid and Robot genocide, the fact that they were short kept everything fun and fresh as it meant I didn't have to spend an hour to get through the level. They were long enough for me to enjoy the set-up of the money machine and short enough for me to glide along the levels like the fish I was raising (starving). The music was still as cheery and memorable too. I found myself looking up the tracks afterward and playing them while I was doing other things. The first level especially does a fantastic job and constructing the friendly tone of the game. This game is meant for you to have fun with your fish-slavery and money-grubbing efforts. But holy smokes I need to talk about the Credit music. So when I cut the head off of area 4 I found myself at the big showdown when you need to kill the evil menace sending all the evil monsters to destroy your perfect ecosystems. This battle when even high stakes as your population consisted of your pets, the life-long allies that meant the difference between failure and securing yet another pet. So it was both heart-breaking to see them slaughtered and hectic to keep them alive. When the smoke cleared, I had about 4 survivors. But don't worry, that angel fish you acquired like a level ago purposely stayed out of the fight to keep them alive. So the credits roll as my crew is brought back from the watery grave and in a game with a colorful and bright atmosphere the music is surprisingly somber and sad. It's slow and drags along, filling an empty void with a sense of loss. I really found myself not wanting to leave the game as this music played. For me credits and final boss tracks at their best when I get a sense of loss. If the game is really good and doing its job I should be left wanting more and to never leave in the first place. For how simple it is the credits music really left me in that state. I had to sit through it and absorb it all until the end. It's probably one of the few times I've found myself wanting to sit through a credits screen. For that reason alone I give this game a solid 9/10. For a simple point-and-click management game it does its job really well of giving you a bright atmosphere with a fun challenge filled in. There aren't very many decisions and you won't find yourself regretting your purchases too often but the pacing of the game flows smoothly enough to keep me hooked into capping off every area. With that said my nostalgia did not preserve the difficulty or even the little feeding simulator where you can raise fish for shells and steadily upgrade your community within that tank. That for me took too long to build up any money for anything and if you wanted to get the upgrades for the tank like the Bubblator you needed BIG cash. Cash that you could realisitically only get from doing the other gamemodes. That system would be fine if the virtual tank had more impact on the core gameplay. Otherwise the only motivation for getting said shell currency is for the secret pets which can in itself be the ultimate reward. While I liked killing some time with it it wasn't the Zen Garden from Plants vs Zombies where I could get money at a fairly decent rate for some fantastic new plants and upgrades. All in all the feature is something that you might return to on occassion but I didn't find myself sticking to it long.

So that's it, Insaniquarium. The game about fish-feeding that's so insane, it's kept alive and swimming for over 15 years.

32730852.review:
《怪怪水族箱》 厂商POPCAP

当我在steam上看到这款游戏的时候已经10年多过去了。

没想到在那个下载速度100kb/s的年代，花5分钟下载安装好的游戏。竟承载了我一个暑假的回忆。现在想来，没有什么会比在炎炎夏日 吹着空调 养养小鱼 打打怪兽 更幸福的事了。

■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■

游戏有很强的探索性，普通闯关模式一共20关，每一关都会解锁一种新的宠物[spoiler] 还有4种隐藏宠物要通过贝壳购买，一般在2周目解锁才有能力解锁	[/spoiler]每5关都会引进新的高级鱼。第一次玩肯定会被各种宠物的功能以及各种鱼类的生存方式深深吸引。

一共四种玩法，除了普通闯关模式还有计时模式，挑战模式，还有私人水族馆（还能做屏保用）。耐玩性远远超过游戏大小。

总体来说是一款内容丰富而且精致的小游戏  各个地方都有细节 音乐虽然简单但也契合合主题

感谢瓶盖厂带给我的欢乐。期待下一部旷世神作。

29511725.review:
I played this game as a young child, I'm the second eldest of about 20 grandchildren and the fights to play games on grandma's office computer were as you can imagine a bit overdone. Playing this game was overwhelmingly nostalgic, and difficult, I have no idea how far I managed to get as a child but I'm working towards 100% completion.
Insaniquarium is a point and click pet simulator, partially. The battles are fast paced and nervewracking at times. The "pets" both buyable tank filler and special are varied in their designs and abilities, and are fun to collect in the aesthetic tank as well as strategise with in the other game modes. The enemies increasingly more obnoxious and weird. Different game modes and the features shared and unshared between them add variety, and the game comes with a profile feature so your game session you left off on doesnt get mangled by the next (bratty cousin) family member or friend who decides to take a turn.
The game is fairly cheap, children around late elementary school age can get the hang of it and perhaps a little younger then that, its not fallout 4 and its not candy crush but its a pc game classic and I love it to bits.

This is a game where you feed fish that poop money. These fish need to be fed every 5 seconds or they will die. But if you are like me, you use drugs instead to feed the fish, it doesn't make them any happier but it shuts them up for about 2 minutes before they want more fucking drugs, also if the police get suspicious I can always tell them that its fish food. 
There are many types of fish. There is the regular carnivore, who eats your small fish, A living bowl with tentacles that only eats stars made by your fish. A pair of tits with pinchers that somehow releases beetles that feeds a tadpole with oversized eyes that needs to eat a beetle every 10 seconds. And finally we have the fish that's bigger than your mother that literally shits treasure chests. But its not easy keeping them alive. Every 5 minutes, some ugly ass alien comes in and tries to eat your fish, but you can't let the aliens eat your fish or otherwise you will go broke and lose your shit. Fortunately you have Illegal weapons from outer space, so dealing with aliens is easy. After you get enough money, you will need to buy 3 magical egg pieces that magically hatch into a pet that will help you with later levels. Pets come in different shapes and sizes. Some of them are very useful in giving money like the oyster with huge ass lips and some of them are completely useless such as the stupid pink hermit crab that pinches fish that get near the bottom of the tank. Eventually, you will face the leader of the aliens and she wants revenge on your pets that you have hatched. She takes 10 million hits to kill even with a level 8 blaster, but she should be no problem if you play lots of clicker heroes or if you are a perv and a weeb, sakura clickers. After you defeat the leader of the aliens, you will get arrested eventually because of all of the noise you were making with the alien blasters. Also, the fish wouldn't eat the drugs. Moral of story: Don't do drugs and if you do, make a better excuse rather than using it to feed the fish. 100000/10 would get arrested for drug possession again.

In this game, you are the overseer of a mental asylum during World War II. The occupants of said asylum have gone so shell-shocked, that they can't eat food by themselves; so you have to feed them. If you don't let the insane soldiers starve, the government will give you money. Once in a while, a Nazi will break in and attack! Alas, he's no match for your wazer pistow. Eventually, you'll want more money. So you buy more people from the black market, to trick the government into giving you even more money, When you have too much money, you start investing in a giant egg. When the egg has finished building, a Giant Death Robot™ hatches and stomps on Hitler. You get a Nobel Prize and a shower of rose petals.

tl;dr It's Skyrim with fish.

26497029.review:
Insaniquarium Deluxe is an often overlooked gem in the now defunct PopCap's collection. As a child, my father purchased this Christmas Megabundle for about a hundred dollars that included some of PopCap's greatest hits such as Bookworm and Feeding Frenzy. However, as I was trying random games that Christmas Day, I was delightfully surprised by the unique artstyle and gameplay of Insaniquarium and was hooked far after I beat the game. 

This game has strong appeal to me because of many reasons. For one, most gamers will appreciate the casual gameplay that it provides while those that are seeking more difficult waters are provided with the Challenge Mode, a special but optional "hard-mode" that brings, in fact, quite a challenge for such a calm game. Another is the creativity of the development team. From a sluggish snail who helps you gather coins to a vicious shark that will help defend your tank at the cost of some of your small fish, it's obvious that a lot of time was put into making each and every one of these unique characters. And finally, the replay value of the game. The amount of gamemodes and unique options that the game provides not only keeps the game interesting for some time, but also introduces the sort of organization that PopCap games usually have, with an Adventure, Challenge, and Zen option.

Nostalgia aside, I highly recommend this game to anyone of all ages.

比如这款《怪怪水族箱》，整个游戏全程只用到了一个鼠标左键。玩儿法很简单，但内容很精彩，游戏的设计着实出色。当然，纯靠肉手来点，迟早手要累废的……后期金币和怪物同屏，为了省下买武器的钱，曾经开着按键精灵（让鼠标快速连击）打怪……

除了流程关卡和挑战关卡，“虚拟水族箱” 也是非常有情趣的一个部分。尤其是艰难地通关之后，这个看似多余的休闲板块几乎是继续留住玩家的唯一动力了。

（就快要说到伤心之处了……[strike] 大小伙子矫情个屁 [/strike]）

没记错的话，中期在商店里会买到一个鱼妈妈，她会生小鱼 [strike]（当然了） [/strike] ……但一开始我并不知道她生出来的小鱼其实是有多么特别。记不清她是会生出一条隐形鱼还是一条会掉落钻石而不是普通钱币的小鱼了。一开始小鱼没长大的时候是看不出来的，我把它当成普通鱼卖掉了，后来才意识到她生出的那条鱼在以后的商店里是无论如何都刷新不出来的。而在此之后她生出的就都是普通的鱼了。
失手卖掉那条特殊小鱼之后，我只能盼着商店以后再刷新出什么更稀有的品种。但商店要么不刷新，要么刷出的鱼没什么新意。为了加快刷新，我就反复把 WinXP系统时间往后改一些，增加几小时，甚至几天、十几天，都不一定。可即使我往后改出去了好多年，也没用，刷新出的鱼只不过颜色更缤纷罢了，种类和属性都和已经有的鱼一样。再没有出现过鱼妈妈第一次生出的那种隐形小鱼……记得有那么一阵子，我每天放学（那时还在上初中）回家都打开电脑刷刷水族箱的商店，持续了个把月吧，终于灰心了，就再也没玩儿过这个游戏。

等后来上了高中、大学，有时候我想下载这个游戏都找不到了。
直到今年呐，2016 年，居然在 steam 上发现有这个游戏！！！
而且还这么便宜，毫不犹豫地买了。
也是盼着玩儿着玩儿着兴许能拾回那条失手卖掉的鱼，当然，即使她不会复现也无所谓。这个游戏本身已经足够就好了。

25851448.review:
Ahhh I remember playing this game as a kid. It was one of my favorite computer games, if not THE favorite at the time. I really love this game! It might be an aquarium game, but the twists this game puts into it makes it great.
Buy fish, feed fish, watch them give you money, get more fish, get fish that eat those fish giving more money, etc =
Profit
This game also has aliens! Every now and then, an alien will pop up in the tank, and you have to kill it before it kills all your fish. There are several different aliens and ways to beat them. Normal ones, ones you need to feed to kill, two headed, rocket launching and more. 
There are four different tanks, five levels for each one. You can also play a timed version of said tanks, where the objective is to collect as much money as you can in a short amount of time, some of it going to your virtual tank. The vitrual tank is basically a normal, virtual fishtank. It's what it sounds like. For this tank you earn shells, which you do NOT earn as quickly as simple coins in the main game. Every day new fish are for sale, and if you are lucky, you might even find some color changing ones. There is also challenge, which you can play after beating the main game (which I have never gotten to. Never got that far.)
To end each level you need to buy the three parts of the egg, the eggs getting more and more expensive as you go on. After doing so, you get a new pet. You can have three active at once, and they can do several things. Feed your fish, gather money, fight of aliens, give you new fish, make money, and more. There are also very expensive bonus pets you can buy for shells. 
At first it's pretty slow, but once you get a lot of fish in your tank towards the end of the levels, it can get pretty hectic, especially later on. You will need to click constantly! Switching from collecting as much money as you can to feeding your fish so they don't die, to making sure the fish with more special needs don't die, and fighting off the occational alien.
This game is awesome, and I would highly recommend it. It might be a bit old, but it's fun nonetheless.

I remember playing this back in the day, and was excited when I saw it on Steam!

Pros:
- Easy Learning Curve, Kid/Family friendly
- Cartoony graphics still look good/aged well
- Mechanics build upon one another as stages progress
- Relaxing gameplay, you feed fish and eliminate invading aliens
- Upgradeable fish tank similar to PvZ's Zen Garden, able to use as screen saver!

Cons:
- Not entirely difficult to master by the end of the campaign
- No cloud saving at this time
- Beginning of levels are slow, this is why I play one or two levels at a time.
- Screensaver upgrades are costly if you dont let it run
- Repetitive gameplay, all levels are played about the same the first half.

Would I gift to a friend?
Eh, I suppose I would if he or she was interested in it. It's a cute little time sink but nothing super challenging or modern. Maybe it can also be a nice little surprise gift. This is a relaxing game to me, if I want to share that experience then I would think about gifting this. Otherwise, there's other multiplayer games and other games with a little more fizz.

Insaniquarium Deluxe - это казуальная игра от компании PopCap.

Название переводится как "Безумный Аквариум".
Вам даётся аквариум, ваша цель - покупать и кормить рыбок, дающих монетки, покупать разных морских существ, уничтожать различных пришельцев, вторгающихся иногда в аквариум, также покупать апгрейды качества еды, её количества и оружия. Также вы после прохождения каждого уровня получаете новых компаньонов, которые помогают следить за рыбами либо дают деньги. В игре есть бонусные уровни.

Кроме того, в игре есть режим Скринсейвера, где на заработанные на бонусных уровнях деньги вы покупаете разных рыбок, даёте им имя, они не могут умереть в этом режиме от голода. Этот скринсейвер можно запустить отдельно для Windows (но у меня возникли проблемы с ним в Windows XP).

Рекомендую любителям казуальных игр.

20741172.review:
A simple aquarium simulator... except not. This one heck of a real time strategy game disguised as a casual game involves keeping fish alive, having them poop money, managing your money, and fending off aliens so they don't eat or kill your fish. Or you can commit acts of cruelty by having the alien follow your fish (or better, bash it with a laser towards your fish) while they're following an angler fish, feeding a fish a star potion when it is too small, buying a guppycruncher without having any small guppies to eat, or other things. You decide! It is fun either way (but you will only progress through the former, not through acts of cruelty).

You play with the mouse, and depending on how you play, you will hurt your pointer finger or your mouse. Thankfully, there are features that ease this, such as other fish or creatures (e.g. carnivors or star catchers) you can buy that reduce the amount of bits of money to collect (diamonds as opposed to several gold coins, or pearls as opposed to beetles) or upgrades to your weapon... there are other features that you will find out yourself, but pay the money to save your finger... or your mouse.

This game looks dated and cartoony, but PopCap has made a masterpiece that is an insane mix of real time strategy, simulation, and shooter that picks at your trigger finger and your smarts. It has high replay value and you also get to have your very own virtual tank to keep (as opposed to the fish you have to defend against aliens). I was a kid when I first played this game online on MSNgames, and now I bought it on sale from the Steam store, and I don't regret my purchase. I think you will enjoy it too, and join in the insanity.

18212093.review:
This may be an old game, but you got to give it up to Popcap for making a game so jam-packed with features. Although no longer updated by Popcap Games, Insaniquarium truly is a jack-of-all-trades game.

For a measly $4.99, Insaniquarium has it all:
- Feed the cute fishes
- Simple point & click style
- Many upgrades and items, giving it a Management feel
- Pet collecting
- Aquarium customization
- Cute artwork and music (for it's time)
- Infinite replayability
- Fun grinding. 
- Using your tank as a screensaver. Wurf evri penny!

For those wanting something more metal, Insaniquarium also has:
- Many levels to play in, but it's all a replay of four tank environments
- Time-trials for those who like it
- Rediculous Bosses(I'm looking at you Bilaterus)
- Decent shooting mode with many weapon upgrades
- Some hard strategy needed to keep fishes alive while making the most money
- Grinding and expensive items. But its so fun, you'll have a lot before you know it!

Quite an old game now, but still awesome, fun and quite addicting; And I just love the nostalgia of playing games I played as a child! ^-^

Feed and grow your own fish, once grown your fish will drop coins/gems which can be clicked on to collect them. Collect all the money and buy more fish! :)

There is a few different modes, Adventure where you have to complete an Egg by purchasing parts of it in thirds; in order to get the money you need to feed and grow your fish and use that money to invest in more fish to get more money quicker until you have enough to buy the egg parts. There is also enemies which will appear through a magical portal of some kind which will eat your fish - Don't worry though, your mouse is equipped with the finest lazer guns and can be upgraded for even more firepower.

Time Trial mode is unlocked once each tank has been completed, and does exactly what the name implies. Get the most amount of money while being timed. The more money you get, the more "Shells" you'll earn. Shells is the ingame currency for the Virtual Tank.

The Virtual Tank is as it implies, a virtual fishtank. Purchase fish which you can name and feed every day.

There's also Challenge mode, but requires finishing Adventure mode in order to be unlocked.

Like most of the people who've reviewed this game, I played Insaniquarium when I was very young. Before I get into details, this game definitley takes [u]alot[/u] of clicking. Be that as it may, the lot of clicking that you do is quite rewarding. The game goes in depth with unlockables, and different forms of items you are able to purchase. Being one of PopCapGames most sucessful games, Insaniquarium offers many great levels, game modes, and a variety of different fish you can choose from to raise. Some fish you can raise in your own Virtual Tank, that you need to check on from time to time to make sure they don't starve. Many of the fish available for purchase(in-game purchase) do a variety of unique things, making you all the more inclined to get more.

As you play the main Adventure Mode, you will discover many different species of pets, whether it be an angler fish, an electric eel, or even a deepwater lobster. These pets aid you in taking down enemies and feeding your fish to gain higher  funds in your wallet, and overall increase the flow of gameplay.

Please acknowledge that this game isn't for everybody. The vast amount of clicking and expanding the tank, could leave your hand tired overtime. The good thing about it, every click is rewarding in one way or another. I highly reccomend this game, as it is very addicting. You keep unlocking things, pushing you to keep going. 10/10

13778046.review:
Fish tanks provide a beautiful display in your home, with all sorts and sizes of fish, it can be quite addicting watching them interact with eachother, or clean out your tank and even swim in schools of dozens. However, it is a responsibility. Before getting a fish tank, here are some basic rules that you should know;

A great starter fish is a Guppy, they are small, inexpensive and not too hard to care for. 

Flakes are a simple and effective diet for fish, and guppies live them! When feeding it to them, they will eventually grow. 

When guppies grow, they will begin to shit out nickels and dimes. When they reach thier maximum size, the dimes will turn into gold coins. This is natural for a fish, and can pay off bills.

Soon, you can try a more advanced fish, a predator Oscar that eats young guppies. Because guppies turn a flake into pure gold, the Oscar manipulates this and turns the guppy itself into a diamond and poops it out. Again, quite natural, it's called reverse bankruptcy.

However, sometimes advanced alien fish overlords will teleport into your tank, and eat every fish you loved. To combat them, you need a gun! I prefer a starter Glock 17, yet later they'll send in heavier alien overlords into your tank, even multiples at a time. Once this happens, you need to buy a sawed off shotgun from your local gun dealer. You have to be careful though, bullets can sometimes break the glass of your fish tank if not used correctly. 

You can also use a kitchen knife to kill these 3" aliens and then throw them on the barby to feed your family and friends at a party. It sure will make an impressive entree. 

Now, guppies and Oscars aren't the only fish you can get. You can get a minature yellow finned penguin that can get pregnant by the water itself. 

Finally, if you want to upgrade your fish, you can feed them FDA (Fish Department Area) approved Asprin Fish Pills that are much better than flakes or pellets. You can also feed them Science Stuff in a jar to make fish shit out golden stars from Super Mario World. 

Thank you for reading, may your fish tank prosper and not be overtaken by alien fish overlords.

我的第一篇评测，记得第一次玩的时候还在上初中，当时的家里电脑不能联网但还是从其他方法下载了这款游戏，不得不说宝开的游戏精品真的不少经常让人眼前一亮（好像手游很坑）。言归正传（真的又是一个点的手抽经的游戏不夸张最后手抽经疼的打个不恰当的比方，好像南方人冬天玩劲舞团...好吧我没玩过而且也没这么疼，比点饼干还折腾手)。话说，这叫哪门子的言归正传啊！！
     饲养具有各种特性的鱼，可爱有趣又实用的小宠物们，各种各样的外星人（你不说我都忘了它们居然是外星人...），游戏音乐我也很喜欢（植物大战僵尸的音乐好像也是获过奖的）不过有个缺点，因为敌人的刷新时间是固定的所以BGM你不暂停游戏的话是不可能听完完整的一整段的，有点可惜，游戏难度友好，同时刷出两种敌人的时候还是挺有挑战的（但是时间玩长了对手不好）所以少年把你的（外星枪？）升到MAX吧，道具升级很简单但也不无聊，鱼之间也有着奇妙又有意思的生态圈，美式幽默自然而且有宝开的风格，boss战也是小宠物们团结在一起（等着被吃），而且这浓浓的僵尸博士既视感（虽然这游戏比植物大战僵尸早）没想到这11mb的游戏居然这么有意思(而且这游戏菜单界面的既视感不多说了你懂的），就算现在玩玩也完全不觉得无聊，既使已经通关一周目但还是有不少要素等着你集齐能再多消耗你不少时间，一周目通关后的内容感觉比植物大战僵尸要丰富有趣，商店中还会时不时刷新出来一些稀有物种，（改系统时间就没意思了啊），那个刷怪门还是没能买到，屏幕保护也是当时我的最爱的功能之一又能刷钱又能写写作业，直到后来我还没通关生存的最后一关，（当时熊孩子智商着急吧）金奖杯也没有拿到手，而现在可以弥补这个缺憾了？（或许喜+1）不过当时能认识到这个游戏时也是有一种说不出来的愉悦感。
     好吧，原谅我词穷先到这里了，顺便这游戏也好几年前的了就不能再便宜点吗，50%优惠还是觉得有点不甘心（勿喷），继续看小马去了，这评测耗了我不少时间。

13188238.review:
Do not let the cute fish, improbable aliens, and frantic clicking fool you.  At its heart, Insaniquarium is a strategy game.  It just isn’t a very good one, despite its novel premise which has players managing an aquarium filled with creatures that literally poop gold.  

Should these riches be saved to buy an early exit from the level, or should they go towards the purchase of an additional fish?  Would it be worth it to research fancier lasers for fending off those pesky interdimensional invasions?  These are questions that players will likely ponder before realizing they don’t matter, since everyone gets to the goal line thanks to the title’s incredible ease.  For a game so heavily driven by decision points and planning, the lack of consequence undermines the whole experience.

For a full review, check out:

10678366.review:
Quite possibly the best game ever created.

The level of strategy required to play this game is nearly incomprehensible; I found myself having to have a piece of paper nearby just to draw out budget plans, and that's not even touching the complex combat system. When combat occurs, there's a sharp balance you have to hold between managing aggression and doing damage; less attacks per second to keep an important character safe, or more to finish him off but maybe propel the alien into your school? It's very difficult to the point that survival horror comes to mind as a genre.

The budgeting system is intense. Allocating funds between fish and weapons borders on art instead of strategy. Don't walk into this game expecting a casual experience. Without spoiling too much, I'll say that the upgrade mechanics are also amazing. While it's usually linear improvement, expect stellar new graphics and sounds along with your stat buffs. There are upgrades for fish, weapons, food, and more that I won't mention.

The soundtrack in this game is absolutely killer. Seriously. It's amazing. You could sleep to the calm tracks, but I can personally vouch that when PopCap wants to build suspense, they build it. They then deliver. Hard. The enemies you'll be fighting in this game are, as previously mentioned, no joke. Those linear upgrades I mentioned are less upgrades and more a scrabble to keep up with the standard of ten steps behind the enemy. Good luck accomplishing even that. And believe me. You'll be pounded with sick beats the whole time.

The cast in this game is great. Deep, dark, thoughtful lines and lovable characters, models, and animations make this game truly beautiful and unforgettable. Every death is truly a tragedy. The end credits are mostly comic relief (literally the first you'll see in the entire game), so they lack a bit in the way of factual information. Through my own research, I've found a few of the character actors:
1. The dolphin's sounds were ripped directly from a Soviet nuclear submarine.
2. One of the "hidden" special characters' grunts are from Sylvester Stallone's first role ever. I'm not sure they attained the proper licensing, but it looks like the beginnings of the lawsuit were swept under the rug.
3. The guppies sound like a plethora of different actors, but is actually just Bill Murray pretending to be hundreds of other actors.
4. The final boss is voiced by Bill Murray acting as himself.
5. The last one I could figure out was the carnivores' bite sounds are the exact same sound as the dog bites in CoD: Ghosts. I'm not sure how that happened, but I promise that if you compare them they're exactly the same.

The last thing I'd like to touch on is the amazing graphical expertise that the art department at PopCap has. Genuinely soothing and peaceful graphics put you into a calm state right along with the soundtrack; that is, until and alien shows up and the advanced gore engine tosses guppy shreds all over your tank. The shading effects are also amazing. Shadows are affected by laser blasts and temporal warp shifts (TWSs as known ingame), and you can almost see the reflection in a guppy's eye as her beloved little sister is strewn halfway across the tank by the razor-sharp teeth of an extraterrestrial. When it needs to build suspense, it acknowledges the hardware shortcomings of the time and leaves a lot to the imagination; however, I promise you that when that suspense finally culminates, you'll wish they'd left a little more to be imagined.

This game definitely isn't for casuals or noobs. I'm not trying to be offensive, but I promise that it'll stomp you into the ground over and over, and its version of a reprieve is stepping back long enough to pull on a pair of steel-toes. The only tip I can give is to avoid indecision because I promise that if you falter for even a second, it'll destroy your guppies so fast that your economy will be irreparably tanked. And if you ever try to turn tail and run, you shouldn't be surprised to find some boot laces dangling from your nose. At least you can take comfort in the fact that the biggest inconvenience you gave the AI was having to dislodge its heel from your colon.

For a price less than the cost of a combo meal at most fast food places, it's definately a lot of fun for several hours.  It's simple but never really boring, you buy, feed, and profit from fish until you can no longer feed them fast enough to even take a second to buy more fish.  The alien attackers are intuitive as well, some incredibly frustrating to deal with if you are not quick with your reflexes and key presses.  The fact that I am glad I have a gaming mouse so I can click at rapid speeds hopefully helps to show this is not entirely like all your other bargain bin games either.

I reccomend it, at the very least get it when it goes on sale for $2.49, it's a good price for a good time-sync that you don't have to invest all your time into.

9469982.review:
Back before PopCap was bought by EA and the company saw the detriments that the very move brings, they made the most awesome "casual" games that somehow intrigued both casual and hardcore gamers alike. PopCap's major successes include Bejeweled, Peggle, and Plants Vs. Zombies, but through playing all of their games for the past twelve years, Insaniquarium is by far my personal favorite, and in my opinion, the most original, creative, and fun. 

This game is part simulation, part "management", part tycoon, part action, and all sorts of...well, insanity. You are put in charge of an aquarium, where you can buy goldish, carnivorous fish, and many other types of creatures that you grow and make money off of. (First win of the game: goldfish poop money!) You use this money for upgrades (upgrade the food to make the fish grow faster and get hungry less often, buy carnivorous fish that poop diamonds but eat little goldfish, etc.). You have access to dozens of unlockable aquarium pets throughout the game that help you in various ways, and you choose which three you'd like to bring to any level. Oh, but I haven't mentioned the aliens. That's right, folks, aliens are so jealous of your awesometacular aquarium that they'll attack, and throughout the campaign the aliens get fiercer (and sometimes come in multiples!). Aliens will eat your fish, but not if you kill them first with a laser gun that you can also upgrade...with the money your fish poop, of course.

Not only does this game have a great campaign that will keep you busy over the course of quite a few hours, but it also presents new challenges to the player along the way, in the forms of various alien types, different fish you have to figure out how to make profitable, etc. Not only that, but throughout playing you'll unlock sea shells that serve as currency for a "Pet Aquarium", where you can purchase fish (among other things) for a relaxing sim aquarium. These fish are essentially the same species from the game, but they come in a large variety of color combinations and sometimes even have special skills (some hilarious, some useful, etc.). What's even better? The selection of fish in the store is randomized and changed daily, meaning you'll come across some really awesome fish one day that you might not see for awhile again, so you can save your shells and get rarities or even just cool looking fish to add to you aquarium. You can collect quite a few, and you can even name them. You also have access to their "interests" screen, where you can learn more about your fish. Does Gill like to take walks in the park? How long have you owned little Floater? You can see all that and more.

Insaniquarium is a perfect example of PopCap at their finest. Sure, the game is "casual", but it offers you so many options and it has so much detail that many developers wouldn't have added in (like telling you your fish's interests, for example). If you are a fan of PopCap's earlier work, buy this. If you are a fan of simulation or tycoon games, buy this. If you are looking for a game with a sense of humor to pass a few hours, buy this. This is PopCap's best effort, and will forever be a classic.

8973555.review:
Excellent. Very interesting.

Basic rules are simple: feed fish, and fight aliens. But this game has tons of ways to make this fun and addictive.
There are pets that you unlock as you progress. Every stage you can pick 3 pets to aid you in various ways, such as helping feeding, attacking, or providing information. A good combination requires quite some thought.
Aliens come in a lot of types, each with a different attack pattern. There are aliens that shoot missiles, aliens with two heads, aliens that can regain health, aliens that are killed by being fed, you name it. Fighting is intense, because you have to avoid having all your fish eaten.
What I like most are food chains. In each of the 4 stages there's a different food chain. You start from cheap guppies, then earn enough money to buy a "shark"(I forgot its correct name) that feed on guppies. Fish at a higher level cost more, require food that cost more, and in return produce more money. Creating a healthy ecosystem in the tank feels GOOD.

+ raise fish!
+ create an ecosystem
+ intense battle
+ virtual tank
- no flaw yet
10 out of 10, masterpiece.
